intro: Pimpinella divisa, commonly known as the divided pimpinella, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats. Pimpinella divisa is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and historical use in traditional medicine.
